definition: variant of 魯莽|鲁莽[lu3 mang3]
thick weeds/luxuriant growth/Illicium anisatum, a shrub with poisonous leaves/impertinent

sentences.english: Some measures are taken to prevent the reckless drive.
sentences.chinese: 採取一些措施對付鹵莽駕駛。

sentences.english: I regret that his own reckless.
But you need to be wary of reckless action.
sentences.chinese: 但是你一定要謹慎行事，一定不要鹵莽行動。

sentences.english: It is a dynamic that provides a sharp contrast to the sometimes reckless teachings of her Master.
sentences.chinese: 這與她師父有時鹵莽的教導形成了鮮明的對比。

sentences.english: She complained to me about his rudeness.
Lodovico. Where is this rash and most unfortunate man?
sentences.chinese: 羅多維科這鹵莽而不幸的人在哪兒？

sentences.english: Though he acted rashly, he had some excuse.
sentences.chinese: 他雖然行動鹵莽，但亦不無理由。

sentences.english: His rashness led ultimately to his ruin.
sentences.chinese: 他的急燥鹵莽最終導致了他的毀滅。

sentences.english: John Gotti was a violent and reckless hoodlum from his earliest days.
sentences.chinese: 高提一開始是個殘暴鹵莽的混混。

sentences.english: The driver of the car was arrested for reckless driving.
sentences.chinese: 這輛車的司機由於鹵莽駕駛被拘捕。

definition: to plan and consider/to reflect on one's best strategy
to die or be martyred for a noble cause/to be faithful unto death
Zou Yan (305-240 BC), founder of the School of Yin-Yang of the Warring States Period (475-221 BC)
orpiment/arsenic trisulfide As2S3/make changes in writing/malign/criticize without grounds
Classic of Rites (same as 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4])
the State of Qǐ in modern Qǐ county 杞縣|杞县, Henan (c. 1500-445 BC), a small vassal state of Shang and Western Zhou for most of its existence
my limited view (lit. view through a thin tube)/my limited understanding/my opinion (humble)
old variant of 補缺|补缺[bu3 que1]
